textos_fuente.text: Contact Us Free Community Shred Day to be held at our Aberdeen, Raymond and Long Beach branch locations - Saturday, September 20th from 9AM to Noon. Bring your sensitive documents and mail to be securely destroyed on-site. Donations of canned goods for local food banks will be accepted. Charlie Park Menus | Downtown Tallahassee Rooftop Cocktail Lounge, Happy Hour, Brunch Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus MENU Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus Experience next level taste Finalist for Best Martini/Cocktail in Tallahassee for 2022 We strive to push the boundaries of the typical dining experience with playful combinations and the freshest elements. We want you to sit back and enjoy the view of Cascades Park with bold and intriguing flavors that will leave you dreaming of your next Charlie Park Experience. - Monday-Friday Open 4:00pm for Bar Services and Limited Happy Hour Snacks Saturday Open 3:00pm for Bar Services and Limited Happy Hour Snacks after Brunch from 10:00am-3:00pm Full Menu Starting at 5:30pm (Monday through Saturday) - Monday-Thursday: Kitchen Closes 10:00pm Friday-Saturday: Kitchen Closes 11:00pm Saturday and Sunday Brunch: Kitchen Closes 3:00pm Drinks Menu Our innovative beverage program delivers sophisticated cocktails, offering fresh, floral and herbaceous concoctions, as well as expertly curated wines and spirits. view menu Dinner menu Enjoy a chef curated seasonal menu with the vibrant and fresh flavors to enhance your dining experience. View Menu Happy Hour SIX DAYS A WEEK Monday - Friday 4:00pm-7:00pm Saturday 3:00pm-5:30pm View Menu Brunch Tallahassee's Best Rooftop Brunch. Every Saturday & Sunday 10:00am-3:00pm. View Menu HOURS: M-Th: 4:00pm - 11:00pm (Kitchen Closes 10:00pm) Fri: 4:00pm - 1:00am (Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sat: 10:00am - 1:00am (Brunch Ends 3:00pm, Dinner Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sun: 10:00am - 4:00pm (Kitchen Closes 3:00pm) CONTACT: 801 S Gadsden St, Tallahassee, FL 32301 info@charlieparkrooftop.com 850-759-4300 Employment Inquiries FAQ GAMEDAY SESSION GIFT CARDS HAPPY HOUR ©
            2025            For the Table Hospitality

FAQ | Downtown Tallahassee Rooftop Cocktail Lounge Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus MENU Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus FAQ Here you'll find answers to our most frequently asked questions. Where do I park? Parking is available throughout Cascades Park. Click here to see a map provided by the City of Tallahassee with different parking options. Some, if not all, options can be accessed through the ParkMobile app (iPhone and Android available). Valet parking is available through the AC Hotel Parking Garage off S. Gadsden Street for $8 for three hours. Public parking managed by the City of Tallahassee is available on the first two floors of the Millstream apartments parking garage. What is the dining experience? Charlie Park is Downtown Tallahassee's preeminent rooftop restaurant and cocktail experience offering small plates designed to share, larger plates for guests looking for a more traditional dining experience and signature craft cocktails. We have an innovative and exciting dinner menu built around plates to share and experience with others. Dishes are vibrant and flavorful, accented by local ingredients and created by our talented chefs. When does the kitchen close? Monday-Thursday at 10pm, Friday-Saturday at 11pm, and Sunday at 3pm. Do you host special events? Yes! We host special events and special occasions. Whether you are celebrating an anniversary for two or a cocktail party for fifty, we can help turn your visit into an unforgettable experience. Fill out the form on our Special Events page . Do you take reservations? Charlie Park is mostly reservation based. We use a reservation system called Resy and it is extremely user friendly. You can reserve a table through our website or download the Resy app. Parties of nine or more will need to call the restaurant to be connected to our team in order to book a large party reservation or complete an event request on the Special Events page of our website. Please leave a voicemail if no one is available and your call will be returned as soon as possible. What are your hours of operation? Monday - Thursday: 4pm-11pm Friday: 4pm-1am Saturday Brunch 10am-3pm Saturday Happy Hour 3pm-5:30pm Saturday Dinner & Late Night 5:30pm-1am Sunday: 10am-3pm Do you have vegetarian and vegan options? Yes! Check with your server for all dietary needs and accommodations. Do you have a dress code? We want you to be comfortable at Charlie Park with an elevated casual dress code. Can you smoke cigars/cigarettes on the Terrace? AC Marriott Hotel and Charlie Park are smoke-free facilities. There will be no smoking on property, including the Terrace. When do you go 21+? After the kitchen closes and food service ends, Charlie Park will only allow patrons 21+. Do you have take out? Yes, please call us at 850-759-4300 to place an order for pick up. Can I order room service from my room? Yes you can. Unfortunately, the bill cannot be charged to your room and will need to be paid for over the phone or in person. You can even order a bottle of wine to-go. Do you have Gift Cards? Yes! Please email emily@forthetablehospitality.com and she will be happy to help. Large parties staying at the AC Hotel? If you are a large party or a wedding party staying at the hotel and interested in joining us late night please email Emily@forthetablehospitality.com to reserve space that can accommodate your party size. Can I bring a cake? Yes! We have a $25 cake cutting fee. We will store your cake, cut and serve it for your guests and package the remaining cake to-go. If you do not want to pay the cake fee we will be happy to store your cake and return it on your exit. HOURS: M-Th: 4:00pm - 11:00pm (Kitchen Closes 10:00pm) Fri: 4:00pm - 1:00am (Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sat: 10:00am - 1:00am (Brunch Ends 3:00pm, Dinner Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sun: 10:00am - 4:00pm (Kitchen Closes 3:00pm) CONTACT: 801 S Gadsden St, Tallahassee, FL 32301 info@charlieparkrooftop.com 850-759-4300 Employment Inquiries FAQ GAMEDAY SESSION GIFT CARDS HAPPY HOUR ©
            2025            For the Table Hospitality

Charlie Parker | Charlie Parker Biography | American Masters | PBS Skip to main content Skip to footer site map MENU Episodes Shorts Archive Podcast ACCESSIBLE TV SCHEDULE S4E5: Celebrating Bird: The Triumph of Charlie Parker Charlie Parker Biography October 19, 2003 “There was one thing he wanted to do. He didn’t worry about anything else — as long as he could play that horn.” – Jay McShann At age eleven, he had just begun to play the saxophone. At age twenty he was leading a revolution in modern jazz music. At thirty-four, he was dead from years of drug and alcohol use. Today, Charlie “Yardbird” Parker is considered one of the great musical innovators of the 20th century. A father of bebop, he influenced generations of musicians, and sparked the fire of one of the most important and successful American artistic movements. Born in 1920 in Kansas City, Kansas, Charlie Parker grew up just across the river in Kansas City, Missouri. By age twelve he was playing in the high school marching band and in local dance hall combos. It was then that he first heard the new sounds of jazz. Hanging around the Kansas City clubs, the young Parker went to hear every new musician to pass through. Some of his earliest idols were Jimmy Dorsey, Coleman Hawkins, Lester Young, Ben Webster, and Louis Armstrong. As a teenager he married his childhood sweetheart, Rebecca Parker Davis. Living in Kansas City, they had a child, but as Kansas City declined as a center for jazz, Parker longed to leave his hometown for New York. So, just around age twenty, Parker sold his horn, left his family, and hopped on a train to New York, where he was destined to change the face of American music forever. In New York, Parker had difficulty finding work at first, but playing with Jay McShann’s band he began to develop his fiercely original solo style. Within a short while he was the talk of the town and Dizzy Gillespie and other members of the Earl Hines band convinced Hines to hire him. Gillespie and Parker became close friends and collaborators. Of the time Gillespie recalled, “New York is the place, and both of us blossomed.” Leaving Hines, the two moved on to Billy Eckstine’s band, where they were able to expand their range of experimentation. The seeds of modern jazz, or “bebop,” as the new style came to be called, were also being sown by now legendary pianists Thelonious Monk and Bud Powell, drummers Kenny Clarke and Max Roach, and trumpeter Miles Davis. All were frequent Parker collaborators on recordings and in the lively 52nd Street clubs that were the jazz center of the mid-1940s. Beyond his amazing technical capacity, Parker was able to invent a more complex and individual music by disregarding the four- and eight-bar standards of jazz and creating solos that were both fluid and harsh. Though the experiments of jazz were being heard worldwide, in the United States much of the popular media ignored the music and concentrated on the culture — the berets, horn-rimmed glasses, goatees, and language that characterized the bebop style. Jazz critic Leonard Feather noted, “There was no serious attention paid to Charlie Parker as a great creative musician … in any of the media. It was just horrifying how really miserably he was treated. And this goes for the way Dizzy Gillespie was treated — and everybody.” Due in part to dissatisfaction with the amount of critical attention he was receiving and in part to his years of on and off drug use, Parker slipped into serious addiction. On a two-year tour of California, his drinking and drug addiction worsened, and for six months he was in a Los Angeles rehabilitation center. It was not until his tour of Europe that Parker began to receive the attention he deserved. Visiting Paris in 1949, Parker was greeted with an almost cult status. His European trips also encouraged him to expand his musical arrangements, including backing strings for both touring and recording. However, as continuing personal and creative pressures mounted, he went into a tailspin: drinking, behaving erratically, and even being banned from “Birdland,” the legendary 52nd Street club named in his honor. Throughout this time, however, one thing remained intact — Parker’s playing continued to exhibit the same technical genius and emotional investment that had made him great. In 1954, while working again in California, Parker learned of the death of his two-year-old daughter, and went into further decline. He separated from his then common-law wife, Chan Parker, and was reduced to playing in dives. The cheap red wine he had become addicted to was exacerbating his stomach ulcers, and he even once attempted suicide. On March 12, 1955, while visiting his friend, the “jazz baroness” Nica de Koenigswarter, Charlie Parker died. The coroner cited pneumonia as the cause, and estimated Parker’s age at fifty-five or sixty. He was only thirty-four. Though Parker was a titan among jazz musicians of the time, it would take the country at large years to learn that for a short while in the 1940s and 1950s one of the most profoundly original American musicians had walked among them virtually unrecognized. CLIP: 1:00 This TV ad shows how bebop wasn't taken seriously Bebop changed American music but wasn't taken seriously for much of Charlie Parker's life. CLIP: 0:56 The time Charlie Parker rode a horse down 52nd Street Charlie Parker's former partner Chan recalls the time he rode a horse down her street. Charlie Park | Downtown Tallahassee's Rooftop Cocktail Lounge Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus MENU Book a table Book An Event Gallery Menus welcome to Charlie park Tallahassee's Premier Rooftop Restaurant & Event Space Experience Next Level Food & Drink Options Charlie Park is Downtown Tallahassee's preeminent rooftop restaurant and cocktail experience offering dinner, brunch, happy hour and signature craft cocktails. Our food and beverage program is vibrant and flavorful, accented by local ingredients and seasonal inspiration. view our menus Book a Table Reservations are not required but encouraged. For reservations, use the portal below to book online or call 850-759-4300 to speak with someone in person. For after hours, leave a message and someone will get back to you. We can't wait for you to join us for your dining experience! For parties larger than eight please email Emily@forthetablehospitality.com. Book your Charlie Park reservation on Resy Host your event At Charlie Park, we aim to elevate your event and special occasion to an unforgettable experience for you and all your guests. With a multitude of settings to choose from - our main Dining Room, Lounge and Terrace can be configured to best fit your event including a full space rental. book an event Location and Space Charlie Park is Located at 801 South Gadsden St. on the eighth floor of the brand new AC Hotel by Marriott in Downtown Tallahassee. We are walking distance from Cascades Park, Downtown Tallahassee, Capital City Amphitheater, and several other local attractions including Tallahassee’s biggest brewery. Come join us and take in the view from the top! Visit Cascades Park District Tour Charlie Park HOURS: M-Th: 4:00pm - 11:00pm (Kitchen Closes 10:00pm) Fri: 4:00pm - 1:00am (Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sat: 10:00am - 1:00am (Brunch Ends 3:00pm, Dinner Kitchen Closes 11:00pm) Sun: 10:00am - 4:00pm (Kitchen Closes 3:00pm) CONTACT: 801 S Gadsden St, Tallahassee, FL 32301 info@charlieparkrooftop.com 850-759-4300 Employment Inquiries FAQ GAMEDAY SESSION GIFT CARDS HAPPY HOUR ©

Search Popular Searches Fastrack Rides & Attractions Map Contact Us Contact Us Toggle Navigation Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive Contact Us Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive We're here to help Our friendly and knowledgeable team at Thorpe Park would love to answer your questions regarding any aspect of your trip. We are on hand to deal with any ticket enquiry or to help you plan your day and answer any questions that you may have prior to your thrilling visit to Thorpe Park. You can contact us in any of the below ways: Visit the help centre Check out the FAQ pages where answers to most questions can be found. Check out our Help Centre first before contacting us - it's the best place to get the help you need! Help Centre Amending Your Booking Use your booking portal which allows you to amend the dates of your tickets without contacting us. If you still need support in changing your ticket date, get in contact with our team and we can support you. Booking Portal Live Chat Thorpe Park's Digital Assistant is on hand to help you with any enquiries. Our agents are online daily from 9:30am - 4:30pm, or until half an hour before the park closes should you require further assistance. Outside of these hours, you will only be able to contact the Thorpe Bot. To start a chat, click the blue chat icon in the bottom right corner of the page Guest Enquiries If you need to send us and email with a question, you can use our enquiry form. Please remember to check our FAQs first as this is often the faster way to find out the information you need. Average Response Time: 3 Days Contact Form Telephone You can contact our call centre team on 01932 577131 Our agents are on hand to answer your call from 09:30am  - 16:00pm Monday to Friday. We can still be reached via Live Chat or email, for any assistance you may need outside of these times. Want to talk about something specific? Our dedicated teams are also available to help you with the below areas: Guest Feedback We understand the importance of guest feedback and we are keen to hear about your experience. We rely on guests reporting their experience to us to ensure we are always under continuous improvement. Average Response Time: 3 days Contact Customer Services Lost Property If you have a lost item whilst at the park, you can raise a claim with our friends at Boomerang. Visit our Lost Property page for more information and next steps on how to report your missing items(s). Lost Property School Bookings You can visit our dedicated Schools page for all information on organising a school trip with us, prices & planning, resources, and more. Find out more Overnight Stays If you have a query about your overnight stay, check out our Frequently Asked Questions. For anything that can't be answered here, please contact our team on shark.hotel@thorpe-park.co.uk Overnight Stays FAQs VIP Experiences To discuss a new or existing VIP package please email the VIP team on vip@thorpe-park.co.uk Email VIP Experiences Corporate Events To enquire or to book a corporate event, please contact our events team on events@thorpe-park.co.uk Email Corporate Events Charity Requests Here at Thorpe Park, we support Merlin's Magic Wand, which is a global children's charity that supports children facing challenges of serious illness, disability or adversity. For more information please see Merlin's Magic Wand . We often support charities and schools within the immediate locality of the park. Due to numerous requests, only registered charities and schools based within the local vicinity of the park will be considered. Please email all requests through to charity.requests@thorpe-park.co.uk . Please note that we are unable to accept or respond to letter requests unless an email address is given. As we receive many requests each day, we cannot respond to them all. If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks, then we regret to inform you that your request has been unsuccessful. Claims Notification Enquiries The UK Employers Liability Insurance Policy and the Global Public Liability Insurance Policy are both held with Chubb European Group Limited under Policy Number UKCANC33447. Claims are administered by Mclarens and should be submitted via the claims portal. The portal ID is D00029. If you do not have access to the claims portal, claims should be submitted to merlin.tpa@mclarens.com SignLive Contact us using British Sign Language (BSL) For more information click here Sign up to our Newsletter here! Sign up to receive our thrilling email newsletters... and get great offers and discounts!
